did.unittitle: North Hempstead, Oyster Bay, and South Hempstead agreement
did.abstract: One handwritten copy of a 1791 agreement establishing the creation of a public yard for the purpose of pasturing sheep in the towns of North Hempstead, Oyster Bay, and South Hempstead in Long Island, N.Y.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection consists of a single document.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); North Hempstead, Oyster Bay, and South Hempstead agreement, 1977.474, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Public Library, Center for Brooklyn History.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: This collection was rehoused and the finding aid revised by Dee Bowers in 2023.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: One handwritten copy of an agreement establishing the creation of a public yard for the purpose of pasturing sheep in the towns of North Hempstead, Oyster Bay, and South Hempstead in Long Island, N.Y., dated August 22, 1791. A list of signers of the document is also included.
